Description: Bronze model axe-head: made out of thin sheet metal. It has a straight butt with large lugs and a long blade with slightly splayed sides. The cutting edge is barely convex. The piece is moderately corroded.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Nasakhma, Tomb 19 Foundation Deposit NW
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Dows Dunham, 'The Royal Cemeteries of Kush. II. Nuri' (Boston, 1955), 185-6; E. Kühnert-Eggesbrecht, ‘Die Axt als Waffe und Werkzeug im alten Ägypten’ (Berlin, 1969), 121, M GD/20.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (137)
